Guide:

This guide is intended for readers familiar with at least some the technologies / skills involved. It covers the minimal steps needed to start a scooter share business, with some reasoning of methods used. Links will be provided throughout the guide with greater explanation of the tech and skills involved.

For a more in-depth general guide to creating a Serverless full-stack app, Serverless Stack I cannot recommend this guide enough, it was super helpful for me in starting this project.

The steps are layed out in the recommend sequence, however not all steps are strictly sequential. Reader discretion is advised.

Project Overview

Roughly speaking the project can be broken into three sections

Front end Website for our users

Back end Server side code for handling logic of our site

Hardware Scooter and any

Project Map

Technologies used in this Guide

  • AWS

    • Lambda & API Gateway
    • DynamoDb
    • Cognito
    • S3
    • Route 53
    • CloudFront
    • Certificate Manager
  • Serverless
  • React
  • ReactStrap
  • React Router
  • Github
  • NodeJS
  • IOT - Automate app for android
  • Netlify

Prep Work

Research Local Laws

Start thinking about Name / Branding

Install Tools

  • Node.js

  • Serverless Framework

Sign up for AWS (Amazon Web Services) account

For this Project we will be using AWS as our cloud provider, the project is scoped for AWS Free Usage Tier, so if you are new to AWS, your cloud cost should be minimal.

  1. Sign up here

Sign up for Netlify

We will use Netlify for hosting Advantages: Automatic SSL Continuous Integration

Sign up for Github

Will be used for version control and hosting our source code Free accounts can only have public repos As another option

Create an IAM User

This account will be used in AWS CLI and Serverless Framework to access your AWS account

Take a note of the Access key ID and Secret access key.

Add Your Access Key to AWS CLI

Clone Project Repo

git clone 
npm install

Register Domain Name from AWS - Route 53

We will be using Route 53 for registering our domain name and for handling our DNS. Cost will vary depending on domain extension, and name desirability but for a generic .com should cost around $12 a year.

  1. Go to Route 53 on AWS
  2. Search if your domain is available
  3. Fill out contact info and purchase domain.* *Domain registration might take up to three days to complete, but more likely within an hour.

Deploy BackEnd

Deploy backend with serverless 

serverless deploy -v

Take note of UserPoolClientId, UserPoolId, IdentityPoolId, ServiceEndpoint You will need this information later when deploying your front end

Deploy FrontEnd

  1. Get COGNITOUSERPOOLID, COGNITOIDENTITYPOOLID, COGNITOAPPCLIENTID, APPAPIGATEWAYURL

  2. Create a copy of .env then rename copy to .env.local

  3. Fill out required section in .env.local

    1. Copy info from serverless output from earlier.

    REACTAPPAPIGATEWAYREGION = region REACTAPPCOGNITOREGION = region REACTAPPCOGNITOAPPCLIENTID = UserPoolClientId REACTAPPCOGNITOUSERPOOLID = UserPoolId REACTAPPCOGNITOIDENTITYPOOLID = IdentityPoolId REACTAPPAPIGATEWAYURL=‚Äùhttps://7thxsnvbc9.execute-api.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/dev‚Äù

  4. Make any desired changes to src\assets\content.json

  5. Generate favicons

  6. Replace photos

  7. Sign up for [Netlify] (https://www.netlify.com/)

  8. Create new site from Git

  9. Setup Custom Domain

Form LLC

I used https://www.incfile.com they had a free filling deal - not including state filling fees $100 for GA Silver package 15 business days

Overall the process was very quick easy, most of the time is spent declining offers from inc file‚Äôs additional services. They will try selling you EIN filling service for $70, I would recommend against it, because it is very easy to file on your own https://www.irs.gov/businesses/small-businesses-self-employed/apply-for-an-employer-identification-number-ein-online

You will need an EIN to open a business checking account, and if you want to hire any employees.

Get any Permits, Licenses, Misc Government Approval
